Directions
This is a simulation of a non-rotating sphere's trajectory when launched, with the surface roughness determining the sphere's drag profile.

First, select the surface roughness using the drop-down menu,
where \( \large{ \varepsilon } \) is the depth of imperfections and \( \small{ D } \) is the sphere's diameter. Then, choose a launch angle and launch velocity using the sliders:
Now, press !
After the sphere has landed, you may press "Launch" again with different settings to compare trajectories side-by-side.
The plot color legend will help you remember which roughness you used for each trajectory:
Otherwise, press to clear the previous trajectories.
The drag coefficient is displayed as a white circle on the drag coefficient plot. The shape of the curve is only dependent on the roughness of the sphere:
Some information about the sphere is displayed in real-time:
To read more about the governing equations, press . To read more about the author and LearnChemE, press .
